alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 16 at 4:14AM EDT until September 16 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, a high risk for rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Statement, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Accomack and Northampton Counties. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through this evening. For the Coastal Flood Statement, from 8 AM this morning to 4 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Large breaking waves of 6 to 7 ft will result in dangerous surf conditions and a high risk for rip currents. Do not enter or approach the water due to the risk of being swept away. Shallow flooding is possible in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SAXIS VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.0 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 16/01 PM 4.1 1.6 1.4 1-2 NONE 17/02 AM 4.0 1.5 1.5 1 NONE 17/02 PM 4.3 1.8 1.5 1 NONE 18/02 AM 3.0 0.5 0.6 1 NONE 18/03 PM 3.2 0.7 0.4 1 NONE NASSAWADOX CREEK AT BAYFORD VA MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Shore break occurs when waves break directly on the beach. It is extremely important to protect your head and neck whenever you are in breaking waves by keeping your hands in front of you at all times.
